html:
12.23.20  9:33 pm   If your song is 100% complete, does that mean it's coming out soon?

     Maybe a Christmas Special?
12.23.20  9:17 pm   have you ever considered writing an entire song in pig latin?
12.23.20  9:14 pm   is you next project coming soon?
12.23.20  7:52 pm   Since your song is finished (per an earlier answer), will it be released before the end of the year?
12.23.20  7:40 pm   how do you stop worrying about current events
12.23.20  7:16 pm   Which came first the fruit orange or the color orange

12.23.20  4:05 pm   The style of the relationship between your lyrics and music to me seems pretty similar to Paul Simon's. He often talks about a lot of his greatest hits having lyrics that simply sounded right and have the feeling that the music has, rather than having lyrics that have been agonized over for a long time, like Mrs. Robinson. Something I hear him say a lot is "I don't really know what that meant when I wrote it, but later I realized..." Is that in any way your process of writing lyrics, that the goal is that they sound like the music? Or do you craft them to both sound right for the music and mean something intentional and consciously thought of?
12.23.20  3:10 pm   When is your next video coming out or does it not have any date for release yet?
12.23.20  2:42 pm   are u on break rn
12.23.20  12:57 pm   are you done editing your next video
12.23.20  12:51 pm   is it possible to think and write a song at the same time?
12.23.20  12:25 pm   Are u a human?

12.22.20  1:46 pm   (sorry if this question is worded poorly). How do you complete a project?

      Do you finish it in layers

     (first doing all of the music for the project, and then doing all the graphics, etc),

      or do you do it in full stages (fully completing the first 10 seconds, and then moving on the next 10 seconds, etc)
